poem:
The Glitterball Trophy

Among flickers of glitter and dust,  
the dance survives—  
whispers of doubt twirl away,  
forgive the stumble,  
fall into rhythm again.  
Feet trace silent reclamations—  
here, under the spotlight's grace,  
joy spins unbroken,  
held aloft by the music  
of redemption,  
and fleeting applause that  
carries us all back home.
